meanings.definition: Capable of being changed in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The clay was deformable, allowing the artist to mold it into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The rubber band is deformable, stretching easily when pulled.
meanings.sent3: The deformable balloon twisted into funny shapes when squeezed.
meanings.sent4: Her deformable opinions shifted with each new piece of information she received.
meanings.sent5: The deformable fabric draped beautifully over the mannequin, showcasing its flexibility.

meanings.definition: Able to be altered or distorted.
meanings.sent1: The deformable metal could be bent into various designs.
meanings.sent2: The deformable image on the computer screen could be resized with a click.
meanings.sent3: The deformable truth seemed to change every time it was retold.
meanings.sent4: His deformable smile hid the pain he was feeling inside.
meanings.sent5: The deformable shadows danced across the wall as the candle flickered.

meanings.sent1: The deformable plastic bottle crumpled easily under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The deformable toy car lost its shape after being stepped on.
meanings.sent3: The deformable cookie dough spread out too much in the oven.
meanings.sent4: Her deformable resolve weakened when faced with temptation.
meanings.sent5: The deformable ice cream melted quickly in the hot sun.
